product_name: HALF MAGICMagic Drip Glitter Lip Gloss
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingHALF MAGIC's viral Magic Drip Lip Gloss is the ultimate, high-cushion glitter gloss packed with insanely sparkling dimension and luscious shine.
details: DetailsBenefitsNon-sticky & non-tackySmooth & plushFeaturesMultidimensional sparkleRich, cocooning textureCap, collar & vial are made with 30% post-consumer recycled materialsItem 2620083How To UseUse the flat edge of the applicator to fill in your lips, and the tapered tip to precisely line your lips. Build dimension and shine with multiple coats of sparkle.Behind the Magic: Tips & TricksMix and match with Sculptitude 2-In-1 Lip Liners to achieve an endless combination of head-turning lip looks. Define and shade your lips with Sculptitude first, before layering on some extra shine and sparkle with Magic Drip.IngredientsY2K Cherub: Polybutene, Octyldodecanol, Diisostearyl Malate, Polyglyceryl-2 Triisostearate, VP/Hexadecene Copolymer, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Sorbitan Olivate, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Polyethylene, Microcrystalline Wax (Cera Microcristallina/Cire microcristalline), Silica, Tocopheryl Acetate, Tin Oxide, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Red 28 Lake (CI 45410), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use the flat edge of the applicator to fill in your lips, and the tapered tip to precisely line your lips. Build dimension and shine with multiple coats of sparkle.Behind the Magic: Tips & TricksMix and match with Sculptitude 2-In-1 Lip Liners to achieve an endless combination of head-turning lip looks. Define and shade your lips with Sculptitude first, before layering on some extra shine and sparkle with Magic Drip.

reviews.headline: Legitimately my favorite glosses.
reviews.comments: These might be my favorite lip glosses of all time. I own the shade Blushing Lizard, Chaos Prone, and Y2K Cherub, and I LOVE them. It's so hard to find true cool toned lip products and these are that, PLUS they have crazy longevity for a gloss, and have great shine and sparkle. I would loveee to see more shades of this come out! Especially ones like Blushing Lizard that have an almost duochrome effect to it. That and Chaos Prone I am able to wear on their own, but I do like pairing a brown liner with Y2K Cherub because of its frostiness. It makes the most gorgeous, frosty, milky pink lip combo.

reviews.headline: Really good product.
reviews.comments: Very shiny, not sticky, surprisingly long glass and when I'm using with the pencil it stay even longer.

reviews.headline: Good gloss, cheap applicator
reviews.comments: The lip gloss itself is great! I bought Problem Child and Blushing Lizard, and I think both colors are gorgeous. Problem Child is bolder for a late-night look, but I think you could wear Blushing Lizard anywhere. The glitter isn't gritty, so it feels smooth on the lips. My one gripe is with the applicator. The first time I opened my first bottle, the doe foot came off the rest of the wand and got stuck in the top of the bottle! I was able to pull it out with tweezers and use Gorilla Glue to stick both parts of the applicator back together, but it was still disappointing. Granted, this only happened on one of my two purchased bottles, and the other one has been fine so far. Just be careful, I guess.

reviews.headline: LIP GLOSS!
reviews.comments: This lip gloss looks greatbon my lips!

reviews.headline: Glimmer
reviews.comments:
I will be getting more 
I love the shine and color and it's not greasy

reviews.headline: Problem Child is no problem
reviews.comments: I thought it was interesting that a number of people cited this gloss as sticky, I haven't had that issue with it at all. I love the glitter black, and that I can apply it sheer or thick - I'm fair and mostly do thinly, but it still looks black. I look dressed up with just this and a naked face. It doens't last a super long time on, but it's a gloss so I honestly didn't expect it to.

reviews.headline: Meh
reviews.comments: Very sticky and thin. Disappears easily. Very pretty on but better options out there..

reviews.headline: Good, with some caveats.
reviews.comments:
This review is specifically for the Magic Brownie shade, as I have not tested the others. 

The Pros: 

The packaging is unique and fits well in a pocket because of the flat, rectangular design. Magic Brownie applies as a beautiful pink/brown nude, is quite glossy and has relatively comfortable small glitter particles.

The Cons:

For the price point, the packaging does feel on the cheap side - specifically the applicator wand. The doe foot is very small (which some may like), but the wand itself feels fragile - as though time or pressure will cause it to break. The formula, while nice, also does not quite match the price point, but is not sticky (at least for this color).

I would recommend buying it only if it's on sale.

reviews.headline: Problem Child
reviews.comments: I have been wanting a black lip gloss and the sparkle is so pretty. But I was very disappointed in this product. First, the formula is SO sticky. If a stray hair accidentally touches it, it's like glued to your lips. Second, the color is not at all like what is shown in the product photos. I am pale and it goes on light gray. If you layer more on for a deeper color, it settles in the creases of your lips and just looks patchy. And third, you cannot wear lip liner with it! This product erases any other lip product you try to pair with it. I wanted to love it but it's one of my most regretful beauty purchases of the past year - especially at this price.

reviews.headline: Miss for me
reviews.comments: I love this brand, but this was a miss for me. The gloss is so sticky, it is uncomfortable to wear and I end up taking it off every time.

reviews.headline: Proper Glitter Gloss, but a Little Gritty
reviews.comments: The gloss on the lips has a great shine without being thick or goopy. The gloss is thin and spreads nicely on the lips. The glitter actually looks like specs of glitter, and not a frost lip look some "glitter" glosses have. The only issue i have is that when I eat or drink. The glitter in the gloss, if it makes it in your mouth. Feels like you have small flecks of sand in your mouth. It's barable and i feel like everything else is good. So, if you can get pass that for the look i'd reccomend it.

reviews.headline: It ok
reviews.comments: These are ok not great but not bad which for the price point isnt very good. Its not too glossy which I dont like and the applicator doesnt allow for a proficent amount of product to come out. The quality feels the same a the glittery nyx cosmetics ones. Overall not worth it.

reviews.headline: Exactly what I was looking for!
reviews.comments:
I love the color payoff of this gloss. The brown, black, and pink shades are great. I would recommend this if you want a cool toned sparkly gloss. The texture is fine. It dries down a bit and smooths out. As long as you buy this knowning what texture glitter has you will be fine. This is not a lip oil. The color lasts a decent amount of time for a gloss. 

The size of the product is good too. I'd rather have a smaller tube and run out than have it sit in my purse.  

My lips are sensitive and I have had no irritation with this brand!

reviews.headline: Very pretty but..
reviews.comments: I love the color payoff but I just can't get past the texture it is so gritty I do not like that, the color is very similar to fenty glosses that are also glittery without the horrible texture I'll just stick to those.

reviews.headline: nothing on your lips will last :(
reviews.comments: i am so sad about this one. i'm basically a cool toned ghost, so i'm always searching for cool and black glosses. this one got me so excited that i showed it to my sister. i bought one myself AND she got my one for christmas thinking it would be perfect based on the video reviews. i guess people are reviewing it before they spend a full day out? the gloss is gorgeous but not only will it not last, but it will take your lip liner off with it. two hours of talking with my friend (no eating or drinking or anything touching my lips) and the only thing left was the liner that was on my skin lightly above the lip. not cute. makes me sad that something 3x the price of elf has even less staying power than elf. it's so pretty and i want to love it but it's SUCH a hassle unfortunately :((((((

reviews.headline: It doesn't sparkle as much as I expected
reviews.comments: I've been looking for a glitter lip gloss similar to one I already have just in another color. I was a little disappointed with this one as it doesn't have very much sparkle or shine to it.

reviews.headline: A wonderful surprise
reviews.comments: I got this as my free gift as a diamond member and I was pleasantly surprised. I got a darker shade and thought it wouldnt work for my fair complexion but thats not the case. Easy to apply. Stunning on the lips. Cant wait to wear it during the holidays. My favorite part is I've never had a gloss like this that lasts literally for hours. I'm really really impressed.

reviews.headline: wanted to love
reviews.comments: i purchased this in the shade problem child. the gloss itself is gorgeous. i didnt love the glittery texture and i found myself having to reapply OFTEN. unfortunately threw the packaging away so i wasnt able to return it. for the pricepoint its not worth it, it's essentially just become a topper to tint/remove warmth and make my other lip products cooler toned. there are definitely other options that just are as good and honestly, in my opinion, work even better (AND COST  3 TIMES LESS) iykyk

reviews.headline: won't buy again
reviews.comments: Its cute, but I feel its not worth the price, way too small and wand looks/feels filmsy, you'll get same or better results with cheaper options.

reviews.headline: So. Pretty!
reviews.comments: This gloss is so pretty! I saw someone I know post about it and I instantly went to the store after it, sinply for the color and packaging. The color itself is STUNNING. The packaging is cute. There is no scent, and its not at all sticky! Overall great gloss!

media.headline: No exaggeration run home and buy this now baddies!
media.caption: Half magic gloss

faceoff_positive.comments: This half magic seriously blew me out the water in other words it was soooooo above my expectations from the presentation and look of the product to the results . It's seriously such a vibe I got so many compliments. I love pairing it with my half magic lip liner as pictured. It's completely worth the price. I am going to stock up on the test ic the shades I can't wait to review more products! It doesn't leave your lips sticky or dry and it's such a classy yet bold look. Definitely makes a statement ladies.
faceoff_positive.headline: No exaggeration run home and buy this now baddies!

faceoff_negative.comments: Love the unique name. Definitely caught my attention. The Frosty B*tch shade is a beautiful, shimmery color that provides a nice frosty sheen when applied. It gives a subtle and somewhat icy look, which is perfect for certain occasions or when you want to make a statement.The lip gloss is relatively easy to apply, and it has a pleasant, non-sticky texture. I appreciate that it doesn't feel heavy on the lips, and it does offer some hydration.However, there are a few downsides that kept me from giving it a higher rating. One, the staying power is not the best. I found myself needing to reapply it more frequently than I'd like, especially after eating or drinking. Additionally, the color payoff isn't as intense as I expected. It's more of a sheer gloss, so if you're looking for bold color, this might not be your best choice.
faceoff_negative.headline: Love the name
